channel.title: Personal Genomics Zone
channel.description: Why does 81% of genomic research exclude most of humanity? Dr. Manuel Corpas examines how genomic diversity--or its absence--shapes the future of precision medicine. Exploring health equity metrics (HEIM), pharmacogenomics, and the global infrastructure needed to make genomic medicine work for everyone, not just a few. Featuring insights on building inclusive genomic research across Latin America, the Middle East, and beyond.
channel.itunes:summary: Why does 81% of genomic research exclude most of humanity? Dr. Manuel Corpas examines how genomic diversity--or its absence--shapes the future of precision medicine. Exploring health equity metrics (HEIM), pharmacogenomics, and the global infrastructure needed to make genomic medicine work for everyone, not just a few. Featuring insights on building inclusive genomic research across Latin America, the Middle East, and beyond.

Exploring health equity metrics (HEIM), pharmacogenomics, and the global infrastructure needed to make genomic medicine work for everyone, not just a few. item.title: Building an Agentic AI System for Personal Productivity
item.dc:creator: Manuel Corpas
item.description: How I built a multi-agent AI system for personal productivity, integrating Claude Code, Telegram bots, ChromaDB memory, and autonomous task execution. A practical look at the architecture, lessons learned, and what agentic AI means for individual researchers.
item.content:encoded: How I built a multi-agent AI system for personal productivity, integrating Claude Code, Telegram bots, ChromaDB memory, and autonomous task execution. A practical look at the architecture, lessons learned, and what agentic AI means for individual researchers.

item.title: Why LLMs Can Hurt Your Academic Writing If You Trust Them Too Much
item.dc:creator: Manuel Corpas
item.description: I spend many hours working with LLMs to help me support my academic writing. This post summarises what I have learned. If you are using LLMs to help write academic papers, grant applications, or technical reports, these observations might save you from some painful mistakes.
item.content:encoded: I spend many hours working with LLMs to help me support my academic writing. This post summarises what I have learned. If you are using LLMs to help write academic papers, grant applications, or technical reports, these observations might save you from some painful mistakes.

item.title: Missing Pieces: Why Genomic Diversity Is the Key to Better Science
item.dc:creator: Manuel Corpas
item.description: Presented at the UK-Indonesia Health Genomics Forum, London, 25 November 2025. When we speak about the future of precision medicine, it is easy to focus on the technology. Yet the real foundation of precision medicine is something much more fundamental.

item.title: The Precision Medicine Paradox: Why Partial Data Cannot Deliver Global Health
item.dc:creator: Manuel Corpas
item.description: By Dr Manuel Corpas. Precision medicine is built on a contradiction. The field promises individualised care calibrated to each person's biology, yet its foundations rest on data representing a fraction of humanity.
item.content:encoded: By Dr Manuel Corpas. Precision medicine is built on a contradiction. The field promises individualised care calibrated to each person's biology, yet its foundations rest on data representing a fraction of humanity.
item.itunes:author: Manuel Corpas

item.googleplay:description: Precision medicine is built on a contradiction.

item.title: Health Data Equity in Latin America in the Age of AI and Genomics
item.dc:creator: Manuel Corpas
item.description: A recap of my presentation to Britcham Brazil, 7 October 2025. This morning I had the privilege of presenting to a distinguished audience at the British Chamber of Commerce and Industry in Brazil.

item.title: Biobanking Meets AI
item.dc:creator: Manuel Corpas
item.description: Lectures from Biobanking for Data Science, a module I lead at the University of Westminster for the MSc AI Digital Health course. The research presented here is my own, specifically exploring how large language models perform when applied to biobank-related queries.

item.title: My Journey to Advancing Health Equity in Genomics
item.dc:creator: Manuel Corpas
item.description: When I'm asked how I became a scientist, I usually smile, because the truth is, I've been aspiring to be one for over 30 years. My career didn't follow the straight path I once imagined.
item.content:encoded: When I'm asked how I became a scientist, I usually smile, because the truth is, I've been aspiring to be one for over 30 years. My career didn't follow the straight path I once imagined.

item.title: Why Diversity Must Be at the Heart of Precision Medicine
item.dc:creator: Manuel Corpas
item.description: Despite breathtaking advances in genomics over the past two decades, we are failing to answer a fundamental question: who benefits from this progress? The sobering truth is that the benefits of precision medicine are overwhelmingly skewed toward people of European ancestry.
item.content:encoded: Despite breathtaking advances in genomics over the past two decades, we are failing to answer a fundamental question: who benefits from this progress?

item.title: Bridging Genomics' Greatest Challenge: The Diversity Gap
item.dc:creator: Manuel Corpas
item.description: Genomics holds the promise to revolutionize healthcare--offering tailored diagnoses, treatments, and prevention strategies. But this vision remains dangerously incomplete without one critical ingredient: diversity.
item.content:encoded: Genomics holds the promise to revolutionize healthcare--offering tailored diagnoses, treatments, and prevention strategies. But this vision remains dangerously incomplete without one critical ingredient: diversity.

item.title: Fireside Chat with Professor Yves Moreau: AI, Genomics & the Ethics of Technology
item.dc:creator: Manuel Corpas
item.description: In this episode I sit down with Professor Yves Moreau from KU Leuven for a deep and thought-provoking conversation on the intersections of artificial intelligence, genomics, and society.
item.content:encoded: In this episode I sit down with Professor Yves Moreau from KU Leuven for a deep and thought-provoking conversation on the intersections of artificial intelligence, genomics, and society.

item.title: A ChatGPT Moment for Genomics: Why Diversity Can't Wait
item.dc:creator: Manuel Corpas
item.description: Imagine two people walk into a hospital. Same symptoms. Same diagnosis. One receives a treatment that works like magic. The other? Nothing. Why? Because what's written in our DNA is as unique as our fingerprint.
item.content:encoded: Imagine two people walk into a hospital. Same symptoms. Same diagnosis. One receives a treatment that works like magic. The other? Nothing. Why? Because what's written in our DNA is as unique as our fingerprint.
